verses.kjv: Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
verses.ct: It was just before the Passover festival, and Jesus understood that his time had come to leave this world and return to the Father. He had always loved his own people who were in the world, and now he showed them the full extent of his love.

verses.kjv: And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him;
verses.ct: During supper, the devil had already planted the idea in the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray Jesus.

verses.kjv: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;
verses.ct: Jesus knew that the Father had placed everything under his authority, and that he had come from God and was going back to God.

verses.kjv: He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.
verses.ct: So he got up from the meal, removed his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.

verses.kjv: After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.
verses.ct: Then he poured water into a basin and started washing his disciples' feet, drying them with the towel he had wrapped around himself.

verses.kjv: Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?
verses.ct: When he came to Simon Peter, Peter said to him, "Lord, are you going to wash my feet?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "You don't understand what I'm doing right now, but later you will."

verses.kjv: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.
verses.ct: Peter told him, "You will never wash my feet!" Jesus answered, "Unless I wash you, you have no share in what I'm doing."

verses.kjv: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.
verses.ct: Simon Peter said, "Then Lord, don't just wash my feet — wash my hands and my head too!"

verses.kjv: Jesus saith to him, He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Someone who has already bathed only needs their feet washed — the rest of them is already clean. And you are clean, though not every one of you."

verses.kjv: For he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.
verses.ct: He already knew who was going to betray him, which is why he said, "Not every one of you is clean."

verses.kjv: So after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?
verses.ct: After he finished washing their feet, he put his outer clothing back on and returned to his place at the table. Then he asked them, "Do you understand what I just did for you?"

verses.kjv: Ye call me Master and Lord: and ye say well; for so I am.
verses.ct: "You call me Teacher and Lord, and you're right to say that, because that's what I am."

verses.kjv: If I then, your Lord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.ct: "So if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you should also wash each other's feet."

verses.kjv: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.
verses.ct: "I've given you a model to follow, so that you would do for each other what I have done for you."

verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.
verses.ct: "Truly, truly, I tell you: a servant is not more important than his master, and a messenger is not more important than the one who sent him."

verses.kjv: If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.
verses.ct: "Now that you understand these things, you will be blessed if you actually practice them."

verses.kjv: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me.
verses.ct: "I'm not talking about all of you — I know the ones I've chosen. But this is happening so that Scripture will be fulfilled: 'The one who shares my bread has turned against me.'"

verses.kjv: Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am he.
verses.ct: "I'm telling you this now, before it happens, so that when it does happen, you will believe that I am who I say I am."

verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
verses.ct: "Truly, truly, I tell you: whoever welcomes anyone I send welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
verses.ct: After saying this, Jesus became deeply troubled in his spirit and declared, "Truly, truly, I tell you — one of you is going to betray me."

verses.kjv: Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.
verses.ct: The disciples started looking at each other, completely unsure about who he was referring to.

verses.kjv: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.
verses.ct: One of the disciples, the one Jesus loved, was reclining next to Jesus at the table.

verses.kjv: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.
verses.ct: Simon Peter motioned to this disciple, signaling him to ask Jesus who he was talking about.

verses.kjv: He then lying on Jesus’ breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?
verses.ct: So that disciple leaned closer to Jesus and asked, "Lord, who is it?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when I have dipped it. And when he had dipped the sop, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "It's the one I give this piece of bread to after I dip it." Then he dipped the bread and handed it to Judas Iscariot, Simon's son.

verses.kjv: And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him, That thou doest, do quickly.
verses.ct: The moment Judas took the bread, Satan entered him. Jesus said to him, "What you're about to do, do it quickly."

verses.kjv: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.
verses.ct: No one else at the table understood why Jesus said this to him.

verses.kjv: For some of them thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buy those things that we have need of against the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.
verses.ct: Since Judas was in charge of the money, some of them assumed Jesus was telling him to go buy supplies for the festival, or to give something to the poor.

verses.kjv: He then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.
verses.ct: As soon as Judas took the bread, he left. It was nighttime.

verses.kjv: Therefore, when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.
verses.ct: Once Judas had gone, Jesus said, "Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified through him."

verses.kjv: If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.
verses.ct: "If God is glorified through him, then God will also glorify him in himself, and will do so right away."

verses.kjv: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me: and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say to you.
verses.ct: "Dear children, I'm only going to be with you a little while longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jewish leaders, 'Where I'm going, you cannot come,' I'm now saying the same thing to you."

verses.kjv: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.
verses.ct: "I'm giving you a new command: Love each other. Just as I have loved you, you must love each other."

verses.kjv: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.
verses.ct: "This is how everyone will recognize that you are my disciples — by the love you show for one another."

verses.kjv: Simon Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered him, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.
verses.ct: Simon Peter asked him, "Lord, where are you going?" Jesus replied, "Where I'm going, you can't follow me right now, but you will follow later."

verses.kjv: Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake.
verses.ct: Peter pressed him, "Lord, why can't I follow you right now? I would give my life for you!"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered him, Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "You would give your life for me? Truly, truly, I tell you — the rooster won't crow until you have denied knowing me 3 times."
